member.name: F:WixSharp.Project.MajorUpgradeStrategy
member.summary:
Defines Major Upgrade behavior. By default it is null thus upgrade is not supported.
If you need to implement Major Upgrade define this member to appropriate instance.
Note: yields WiX UpgradeVersion element, which is arguably the most comprehensive upgrade definition. However in the later versions of WiX a simplified upgrade definition has been introduced. It relies on MajorUpgrade WiX element. For most of the upgrade scenarios you will find that MajorUpgrade allows to achieve the same result with much less effort. Wix# supports MajorUpgrade element via member.

member.name: F:WixSharp.Project.EmitConsistentPackageId
member.summary:
Indicates whether compiler should emit consistent package Id (package code). Set EmitConsistentPackageId to 'false' (default value) if you want the WiX compilers automatically generate a new package code for each new .msi file built. Or set it to 'true' if you want Wix# to auto generate a unique consistent package code for a given combination of the product code, product version and product upgrade code.
WiX package code generation policy discourages the use of this attribute as it is a primary MSI identifier used to distinguish packages in ARP. Thus WiX tools always auto-generate the code for each build. This in turn makes it impossible to rebuild a truly identical MSIs from the same WiX code even with the same set of product code, version and upgrade code.
This very artificial limitation has severe practical impact. For example if a specific MSI file is lost it cannot be recreated even if the original source code that was used to built the lost MSI is available.
From another hand Wix# encourages using a singe GUID (Project.GUID) as a primary identifier of the product. Thus all other MSI identifiers can be derived by the compiler from the unique combination of this GUID and the product version. This also included generation of the package Id attribute controlled by the EmitConsistentPackageId.
Wix# does not changes the WiX default package code generation it just gives the opportunity to control it when required.

member.name: F:WixSharp.Project.BackgroundImage
member.summary:
Path to the file containing the image (e.g. bmp) setup dialogs background. If not specified default image will be used.
If the image is to be used in the default ManagedUI dialogs it will be left-docked at runtime and will effectively play the role of a left-aligned dialog banner. Thus if it is too wide it can push away (to right) the all other UI elements. The optimal size of the image for ManagedUI is 494x312.

member.name: M:WixSharp.Project.HashedTargetPathIdAlgorithm(WixSharp.WixEntity)
member.summary:
Algorithm for generating deterministic Id(s) based on the hash of the target path.
This algorithm addresses the limitation of the incremental-Id legacy algorithm, which it quite reliable but non deterministic.
As any hash, the hash of the target path is not 100% reliable thus if you are packaging very high number files you may occasionally get duplication. Use alternative custom ID-allocation algorithm (e.g. random GUIDs).

member.name: T:WixSharp.PropertyRef
member.summary:
Defines reference to the Wix custom property.
Sometimes it desirable to access WiX properties defined in the extension modules. is designed for such cases. You can use it as an ordinary WiX property but you do not need to set it up (e.g. define initial value) as it is already done in the corresponding extension module.
In a way PropertyRef is similar to C++ #include as it makes possible to access some entities defined in the external modules.
member.remarks: inherits from because of their logical relationship and usability pattern, not because of any "Parent/Child" connection.

member.name: T:WixSharp.RegValueProperty
member.summary:
Defines WiX custom property assigned by MSI runtime during the installation to the RegistrySearch result.
is used to set a property from the registry value when accessing the registry is inconvenient for a custom action.
RegistrySearch returns raw data thus data will always contain prefix indicating data type:
DWORD: Starts with '#' optionally followed by '+' or '-'.
REG_BINARY: Starts with '#x' and the installer converts and saves each hexadecimal digit (nibble) as an ASCII character prefixed by '#x'.
REG_EXPAND_SZ: Starts with '#%'.
REG_MULTI_SZ: Starts with '[~]' and ends with '[~]'.
REG_SZ: No prefix, but if the first character of the registry value is '#', the installer escapes the character by prefixing it with another '#'.
member.remarks: In Wix# the preferred way of setting a property value is assigning it from . However may not be an available option if the target system does not have .NET installed. In such cases should be used.
member.example:
The following is an example of installing DotNET Manual.txt file only if .NET v2.0 is installed.
var project = new Project("MyProduct", new Dir(@"%ProgramMenu%\My Company\My Product", new File(@"Files\DotNET Manual.txt") { Condition = new Condition("NETFRAMEWORK20=\"#1\"") }, ... new RegValueProperty("NETFRAMEWORK20", RegistryHive.LocalMachine, @"Software\Microsoft\NET Framework Setup\NDP\v2.0.50727", "Install", "not_defined"),

member.name: P:WixSharp.RegValueProperty.Win64
member.summary:
Instructs the search to look in the 64-bit registry when the value is 'yes'. When the value is 'no', the search looks in the 32-bit registry.
This is how WiX defines defaults.
The default value is based on the platform set by the -arch switch to candle.exe or the InstallerPlatform property in a .wixproj MSBuild project: For x86 and ARM, the default value is 'no'. For x64 and IA64, the default value is 'yes'.
However this WiX approach creates non-intuitive behaver when the build outcome may depend on the architecture of the build machine.
Thus WixSharp always uses consistent default value for this property: false.

member.name: F:WixSharp.RegValue.ForceDeleteOnUninstall
member.summary: Set this to remove the key with all its values and subkeys when the parent component is uninstalled.

member.name: P:WixSharp.RegValue.NeverOverwrite
member.summary:
Gets or sets the NeverOverwrite attribute of the associated WiX component.
If this attribute is set to 'true', the installer does not install or reinstall the component if a registry value for the component already exists.

member.name: T:WixSharp.ServiceInstaller
member.summary: Defines service installer for the file being installed. It encapsulates functionality provided by ServiceInstall and ServiceConfig WiX elements.

member.name: M:WixSharp.ServiceInstaller.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:WixSharp.ServiceInstaller.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with properties/fields initialized with specified parameters.

member.name: P:WixSharp.ServiceInstaller.Id
member.summary: Primary key used to identify this particular entry.

member.name: P:WixSharp.ServiceInstaller.Name
member.summary: This is the localizable name of the environment variable

member.name: F:WixSharp.ServiceInstaller.DisplayName
member.summary: The display name of the service as it is listed in the Control Panel. If not specified the name of the service will be used instead.

member.name: F:WixSharp.ServiceInstaller.Description
member.summary: The description of the service as it is listed in the Control Panel.

member.name: F:WixSharp.ServiceInstaller.Type
member.summary: The type of the service (e.g. kernel/system driver, process). The default value is SvcType.ownProcess.

member.name: F:WixSharp.ServiceInstaller.Start
member.summary: Defines the way service starts. The default value is SvcStartType.auto.

member.name: F:WixSharp.ServiceInstaller.ErrorControl
member.summary: The error control associated with the service startup. The default value is SvcErrorControl.normal.

member.name: P:WixSharp.ServiceInstaller.StartOn
member.summary:
Associates 'start service' action with the specific service installation event. The default value is SvcEvent.Install. Meaning "start the service when it is installed".
Set this member to null if you don't want to start the service at any stage of the installation.

member.name: P:WixSharp.ServiceInstaller.StopOn
member.summary:
Associates 'stop service' action with the specific service installation event. The default value is SvcEvent.InstallUninstall_Wait. Meaning "stop the service when it is being installed and uninstalled and wait for the action completion".
Set this member to null if you don't want to stop the service at any stage of the installation.

member.name: P:WixSharp.ServiceInstaller.RemoveOn
member.summary:
Associates 'remove service' action with the specific service installation event. The default value is SvcEvent.Uninstall. Meaning "remove the service when it is uninstalled".
Set this member to null if you don't want to remove the service at any stage of the installation.

member.name: F:WixSharp.ServiceInstaller.DependsOn
member.summary:
Semicolon separated list of the names of the external service the service being installed depends on. It supposed to be names (not the display names) of a previously installed services.
For example: DependsOn = "Dnscache;Dhcp"

member.name: F:WixSharp.ServiceInstaller.Account
member.summary: Fully qualified names must be used even for local accounts, e.g.: ".\LOCAL_ACCOUNT". Valid only when ServiceType is ownProcess.

member.name: F:WixSharp.ServiceInstaller.Arguments
member.summary: Contains any command line arguments or properties required to run the service.

member.name: F:WixSharp.ServiceInstaller.EraseDescription
member.summary: Determines whether the existing service description will be ignored. If 'yes', the service description will be null, even if the Description attribute is set.

member.name: F:WixSharp.ServiceInstaller.Interactive
member.summary: Whether or not the service interacts with the desktop.

member.name: F:WixSharp.ServiceInstaller.LoadOrderGroup
member.summary: The load ordering group that this service should be a part of.

member.name: F:WixSharp.ServiceInstaller.Password
member.summary: The password for the account. Valid only when the account has a password.

member.name: F:WixSharp.ServiceInstaller.Vital
member.summary: The overall install should fail if this service fails to install.

member.name: F:WixSharp.ServiceInstaller.DelayedAutoStart
member.summary: Specifies whether an auto-start service should delay its start until after all other auto-start services. This property only affects auto-start services. If this property is not initialized the setting is not configured.

members.member: public object FailureActionsWhen { get; set; } //note implementing util:serviceconfig instead ConfigUtil?.Process(newContext); Specifies time in milliseconds that the Service Control Manager (SCM) waits after notifying the service of a system shutdown. If this attribute is not present the default value, 3 minutes, is used.

member.name: F:WixSharp.ServiceInstaller.ServiceSid
member.summary: Specifies the service SID to apply to the service

member.name: F:WixSharp.ServiceInstaller.ConfigureServiceTrigger
member.summary: Specifies whether to configure the service when the parent Component is installed, reinstalled, or uninstalled
member.remarks: Defaults to ConfigureServiceTrigger.Install. Strictly applies to the configuration of properties: DelayedAutoStart, PreShutdownDelay, ServiceSid.

member.name: F:WixSharp.ServiceInstaller.FirstFailureActionType
member.summary: Action to take on the first failure of the service

member.name: F:WixSharp.ServiceInstaller.ProgramCommandLine
member.summary: If any of the three *ActionType attributes is "runCommand", this specifies the command to run when doing so.

member.name: F:WixSharp.ServiceInstaller.RebootMessage
member.summary: If any of the three *ActionType attributes is "reboot", this specifies the message to broadcast to server users before doing so.

member.name: F:WixSharp.ServiceInstaller.ResetPeriodInDays
member.summary: Number of days after which to reset the failure count to zero if there are no failures.

member.name: F:WixSharp.ServiceInstaller.RestartServiceDelayInSeconds
member.summary: If any of the three *ActionType attributes is "restart", this specifies the number of seconds to wait before doing so.

member.name: F:WixSharp.ServiceInstaller.SecondFailureActionType
member.summary: Action to take on the second failure of the service.

member.name: F:WixSharp.ServiceInstaller.ThirdFailureActionType
member.summary: Action to take on the third failure of the service.

member.name: F:WixSharp.ServiceInstaller.UrlReservations
member.summary: The URL reservations associated with the service

member.name: M:WixSharp.ServiceInstaller.Process(WixSharp.ProcessingContext)
member.summary: Adds itself as an XML content into the WiX source being generated from the . See 'Wix#/samples/Extensions' sample for the details on how to implement this interface correctly.

member.name: T:WixSharp.Shortcut
member.summary: Defines shortcut to be installed. is not supposed to be instantiated directly. Derivative class constructors should be used instead (e.g. , ).

member.name: M:WixSharp.Shortcut.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: F:WixSharp.Shortcut.Target
member.summary:
The path to the executable the shortcut is associated with.
This value is a processed only for shortcuts which belong to the element.

member.name: F:WixSharp.Shortcut.Arguments
member.summary: The shortcut arguments.

member.name: F:WixSharp.Shortcut.Location
member.summary:
The directory where the shortcut should be installed.
This value is a processed only for shortcuts which belong to the element.

member.name: F:WixSharp.Shortcut.WorkingDirectory
member.summary:
"Working Directory" for the shortcut to be installed. If is not specified it will be set in the installed shortcut to the location of the file the shortcut points to defined in the field.
Note, WixSharp will only be able to set correct automatically if is defined as a dir_id + file name (e.g. `@"[INSTALLDIR]\app.exe"`). But it will fail if includs any other bits of path (e.g. `@"[INSTALLDIR]\bin\app.exe"`). Thet's why it is mmore practical to set the explicitly.

member.name: F:WixSharp.Shortcut.Condition
member.summary: Defines the launch which is to be checked during the installation to determine if the shortcut should be installed.

member.name: F:WixSharp.Shortcut.IconFile
member.summary: Defines icon file for the shortcut. Relative or absolute path to the source file containing icons (exe, dll or ico).

member.name: F:WixSharp.Shortcut.IconIndex
member.summary: The zero-based index of the icon associated with this ProgId. The default value is 0.

member.name: F:WixSharp.Shortcut.Advertise
member.summary: Whether this shortcut is to be advertised. The default is false.

member.name: F:WixSharp.Shortcut.ShortcutProperties
member.summary: Shortcut properties

member.name: T:WixSharp.Step
member.summary:
Specifies predefined values for , which controls order of Custom Action to be executed.
Before or After switch for Custom Action is controlled by .

member.name: F:WixSharp.Step.ADMIN
member.summary: A top-level action used for an administrative installation.

member.name: F:WixSharp.Step.ADVERTISE
member.summary: A top-level action called to install or remove advertised components.

member.name: F:WixSharp.Step.AllocateRegistrySpace
member.summary: Validates that the free space specified by AVAILABLEFREEREG exists in the registry.

member.name: F:WixSharp.Step.AppSearch
member.summary: Searches for previous versions of products and determines that upgrades are installed.

member.name: F:WixSharp.Step.BindImage
member.summary: Binds executables to imported DLLs.

member.name: F:WixSharp.Step.CCPSearch
member.summary: Uses file signatures to validate that qualifying products are installed on a system before an upgrade installation is performed.

member.name: F:WixSharp.Step.CostFinalize
member.summary: Ends the internal installation costing process begun by the CostInitialize action.

member.name: F:WixSharp.Step.CostInitialize
member.summary: Starts the installation costing process.

member.name: F:WixSharp.Step.CreateFolders
member.summary: Creates empty folders for components.

member.name: F:WixSharp.Step.CreateShortcuts
member.summary: Creates shortcuts.

member.name: F:WixSharp.Step.DeleteServices
member.summary: Removes system services.

member.name: F:WixSharp.Step.DisableRollback
member.summary: Disables rollback for the remainder of the installation.

member.name: F:WixSharp.Step.DuplicateFiles
member.summary: Duplicates files installed by the InstallFiles action.

member.name: F:WixSharp.Step.ExecuteAction
member.summary: Checks the EXECUTEACTION property to determine which top-level action begins the execution sequence, then runs that action.

member.name: F:WixSharp.Step.FileCost
member.summary: Initializes disk cost calculation with the installer. Disk costing is not finalized until the CostFinalize action is executed.

member.name: F:WixSharp.Step.FindRelatedProducts
member.summary: Detects correspondence between the Upgrade table and installed products.

member.name: F:WixSharp.Step.ForceReboot
member.summary: Used in the action sequence to prompt the user for a restart of the system during the installation.

member.name: F:WixSharp.Step.INSTALL
member.summary: A top-level action called to install or remove components.

member.name: F:WixSharp.Step.InstallAdminPackage
member.summary: Copies the installer database to the administrative installation point.

member.name: F:WixSharp.Step.InstallExecute
member.summary: Runs a script containing all operations in the action sequence since either the start of the installation or the last InstallFinalize action. Does not end the transaction.

member.name: F:WixSharp.Step.InstallFiles
member.summary: Copies files from the source to the destination directory.

member.name: F:WixSharp.Step.InstallFinalize
member.summary: Runs a script containing all operations in the action sequence since either the start of the installation or the last InstallFinalize action. Marks the end of a transaction.

member.name: F:WixSharp.Step.InstallInitialize

member.name: F:WixSharp.Step.InstallExecuteAgain
member.summary: The InstallExecuteAgain action runs a script containing all operations in the action sequence since either the start of the installation or the last InstallExecuteAgain action or the last InstallExecute action. The InstallExecute action updates the system without ending the transaction. InstallExecuteAgain performs the same operation as the InstallExecute action but should only be used after InstallExecute.

member.name: T:WixSharp.WebSite
member.summary: This class defines website attributes. It is a close equivalent of WebSite WiX element.

member.name: F:WixSharp.WebSite.Description
member.summary: This is the name of the web site that will show up in the IIS management console.

member.name: F:WixSharp.WebSite.InstallWebSite
member.summary:
Indicates if the WebSite is to be installed (created on IIS) or existing WebSite should be used to install the corresponding WebApplication. The default value is false
Developers should be aware of the WebSite installation model imposed by WiX/MSI and use carefully.
If value is set to false the parent WebApplication () will be installed in the brand new (freshly created) WebSite or in the existing one if a site with the same address/port combination already exists on IIS). The undesirable side affect of this deployment scenario is that if the existing WebSite was used to install the WebApplication it will be deleted on IIS during uninstallation even if this WebSite has other WebApplications installed.
The "safer" option is to set value to true (default value). In this case the WebApplication will be installed in an existing WebSite with matching address/port. If the match is not found the installation will fail. During the uninstallation only installed WebApplication will be removed from IIS.

member.name: T:WixSharp.WixObject
member.summary: Base class for all Wix# related types

member.name: P:WixSharp.WixObject.Attributes
member.summary:
Collection of Attribute/Value pairs for WiX element attributes not supported directly by Wix# objects.
You should use Attributes if you want to inject specific XML attributes for a given WiX element.
For example Hotkey attribute is not supported by Wix# but if you want them to be set in the WiX source file you may achieve this be setting WixEntity.Attributes member variable:
new Shortcut { Attributes= new { {"Hotkey", "0"} }
You can also inject attributes into WiX components "related" to the but not directly represented in the Wix# entities family. For example if you need to set a custom attribute for the WiX Component XML element you can use corresponding attributes. The only difference from the Hotkey example is the composite (column separated) key name:
new File { Attributes= new { {"Component:SharedDllRefCount", "yes"} } The code above will force the Wix# compiler to insert "SharedDllRefCount" attribute into Component XML element, which is automatically generated for the .
Currently the only supported "related" attribute is Component.
Note the attribute key can include xml namespace prefix:
{ "{dep}ProviderKey", "01234567-8901-2345-6789-012345678901" }
Though in this case the required namespace must be already added to the element/document.

member.name: P:WixSharp.WixObject.AttributesDefinition
member.summary:
Optional attributes of the WiX Element (e.g. Secure:YesNoPath) expressed as a string KeyValue pairs (e.g. "StartOnInstall=Yes; Sequence=1").
OptionalAttributes just redirects all access calls to the member.
You can also use to keep the code cleaner.
Note name can include xml namespace prefix:
AttributesDefinition = "{dep}ProviderKey=01234567-8901-2345-6789-012345678901"
Though in this case the required namespace must be already added to the element/document.

member.name: P:WixSharp.WixObject.Feature
member.summary:
the Wix object belongs to. This member is processed only for the WiX objects/elements that can be associated with the features (e.g. WebSite, FirewallException, ODBCDataSource, User, EnvironmentVariable, Merge, Dir, RegFile, RegValue, Shortcut, SqlDatabase, SqlScript).
Wix# makes an emphasis on the main stream scenarios when an entity (e.g. File) belongs to a single feature. And this member is to serve these scenarios via constructors or initializers.
However MSI/WiX allows the same component to be included into multiple features. If it is what your deployment logic dictates then you need to use .

member.name: F:WixSharp.WixObject.Features
member.summary:
The collection of s the Wix object belongs to. This member is processed only for the WiX objects/elements that can be associated with the features (e.g. WebSite, FirewallException, ODBCDataSource, User, EnvironmentVariable, Merge, Dir, RegFile, RegValue, Shortcut, SqlDatabase).
Note, this member is convenient for scenarios where the same component is to be included into multiple features. However, if the component is to be associated only with a single feature then is a more convenient choice as it can be initialized either via constructors or object initializers.eature.

member.name: F:WixSharp.WixEntity.Name
member.summary:
Name of the .
This value is used as a Name for the corresponding WiX XML element.

member.name: P:WixSharp.WixEntity.Id
member.summary:
Gets or sets the Id value of the .
This value is used as a Id for the corresponding WiX XML element.
If the value is not specified explicitly by the user the Wix# compiler generates it automatically insuring its uniqueness.
Note: The ID auto-generation is triggered on the first access (evaluation) and in order to make the id allocation deterministic the compiler resets ID generator just before the build starts. However if you accessing any auto-id before the Build*() is called you can it interferes with the ID auto generation and eventually lead to the WiX ID duplications. To prevent this from happening either:
- Avoid evaluating the auto-generated IDs values before the call to Build*()
- Set the IDs (to be evaluated) explicitly
- Prevent resetting auto-ID generator by setting WixEntity.DoNotResetIdGenerator to true";

member.name: M:WixSharp.WixEntity.IncrementalIdFor(WixSharp.WixEntity)
member.summary:
Index based Id generation algorithm.
It is the default algorithm, which generates the most human readable Id. Thus if the project has two `index.html` files one will be assigned Id `index.html` and another one `index.html.1`.
Limitations: If two files have the same name it is non-deterministic which one gets clear Id and which one the indexed one.

member.summary: Resets the generator. This method is exercised by the Wix# compiler before any Build operations to ensure reproducibility of the set between Build() calls.

member.name: T:WixSharp.Id
member.summary:
The unique string identifier of the Wix# project item. The Id is automatically generated by Wix# engine during the MSI build unless it is explicitly specified by a project item constructor parameter.
Id is used to "stamp" every XML element of the WiX source file produced by Wix#.

member.name: T:WixSharp.WUI
member.summary: Specifies predefined values for , which control type of User Interface used to interact with user during the installation.

member.name: F:WixSharp.WUI.WixUI_ProgressOnly
member.summary: WixUI_ProgressOnly is "no-UI" dialog set which includes only progress bar.

member.name: F:WixSharp.WUI.WixUI_Minimal
member.summary: WixUI_Minimal is the simplest of the built-in WixUI dialog sets.

member.name: F:WixSharp.WUI.WixUI_InstallDir
member.summary: WixUI_InstallDir does not allow the user to choose what features to install, but it adds a dialog to let the user choose a directory where the product will be installed.

member.name: F:WixSharp.WUI.WixUI_Common
member.summary: WixUI_Common is defines "common" built-in dialog set. It is used to define additional custom dialogs.

member.name: F:WixSharp.WUI.WixUI_FeatureTree
member.summary:
WixUI_FeatureTree built-in dialog set.
WixUI_FeatureTree is a simpler version of WixUI_Mondo that omits the setup type dialog.

member.name: F:WixSharp.WUI.WixUI_Mondo
member.summary: WixUI_Mondo includes the full set of dialogs (hence "Mondo").

member.name: F:WixSharp.WUI.WixUI_Advanced
member.summary: WixUI_Advanced provides the option of a one-click install like WixUI_Minimal, but it also allows directory and feature selection like other dialog sets if the user chooses to configure advanced options.

member.name: T:WixSharp.Return
member.summary: Specifies predefined values for , which controls invoking type of Custom Actions.

member.name: F:WixSharp.Return.asyncWait
member.summary: Indicates that the custom action will run asynchronously but the installer will wait for the return code at sequence end.

member.name: F:WixSharp.Return.asyncNoWait
member.summary: Indicates that the custom action will run asynchronously and execution may continue after the installer terminates.

member.name: F:WixSharp.Return.check
member.summary: Indicates that the custom action will run synchronously and the return code will be checked for success.

member.name: F:WixSharp.Return.ignore
member.summary: Indicates that the custom action will run synchronously and the return code will not be checked.

member.summary: The AdminExecuteSequence table lists actions that the installer calls in sequence when the top-level ADMIN action is executed.

member.name: F:WixSharp.Sequence.AdminUISequence
member.summary: The AdminUISequence table lists actions that the installer calls in sequence when the top-level ADMIN action is executed and the internal user interface level is set to full UI or reduced UI. The installer skips the actions in this table if the user interface level is set to basic UI or no UI.

member.name: T:WixSharp.Execute
member.summary: Specifies predefined values for attribute, which controls at what stage of installation script Custom Action will be executed.

member.name: F:WixSharp.Execute.commit
member.summary: Indicates that the custom action will run after successful completion of the installation script (at the end of the installation).

member.name: F:WixSharp.Execute.deferred
member.summary: Indicates that the custom action runs in-script (possibly with elevated privileges).

member.name: F:WixSharp.Execute.firstSequence
member.summary: Indicates that the custom action will only run in the first sequence that runs it.

member.name: F:WixSharp.Execute.immediate
member.summary: Indicates that the custom action will run during normal processing time with user privileges. This is the default.

member.name: F:WixSharp.Execute.oncePerProcess
member.summary: Indicates that the custom action will only run in the first sequence that runs it in the same process.

member.name: F:WixSharp.Execute.rollback
member.summary: Indicates that a custom action will run in the rollback sequence when a failure occurs during installation, usually to undo changes made by a deferred custom action.

member.name: F:WixSharp.Execute.secondSequence
member.summary: Indicates that a custom action should be run a second time if it was previously run in an earlier sequence.

member.summary:

member.summary: Set this value to declare that the package is a per-machine installation and requires elevated privileges to install. Sets the ALLUSERS property to 1.

member.summary: Set this value to declare that the package is a per-user installation and does not require elevated privileges to install. Sets the package's InstallPrivileges attribute to "limited."

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: F:WixSharp.NativeImagePlatform.x86
member.summary: Attempt to generate native images only for the 32-bit version of the .NET Framework on the target machine. If the 32-bit version of the .NET Framework 2.0 or newer is not present on the target machine, native image custom actions will not be scheduled. This is the default value.

member.name: F:WixSharp.NativeImagePlatform.x64
member.summary: Attempt to generate native images only for the 64-bit version of the .NET Framework on the target machine. If a 64-bit version of the .NET Framework 2.0 or newer is not present on the target machine, native image custom actions will not be scheduled.

member.name: F:WixSharp.NativeImagePlatform.all
member.summary: Attempt to generate native images for the 32-bit and 64-bit versions of the .NET Framework on the target machine. If a version of the .NET Framework 2.0 or newer is not present on the target machine for a processor architecture, native image custom actions will not be scheduled for that processor architecture.

member.name: F:WixSharp.Platform.x64
member.summary: Set this value to declare that the package is an x64 package. This value requires that the InstallerVersion property be set to 200 or greater.

member.name: F:WixSharp.StoreName.ca
member.summary: Contains the certificates of certificate authorities that the user trusts to issue certificates to others. Certificates in these stores are normally supplied with the operating system or by the user's network administrator.

member.name: F:WixSharp.StoreName.my
member.summary: Use the "personal" value instead.

member.name: F:WixSharp.StoreName.personal
member.summary: Contains personal certificates. These certificates will usually have an associated private key. This store is often referred to as the "MY" certificate store.

member.name: F:WixSharp.StoreName.root
member.summary: Contains the certificates of certificate authorities that the user trusts to issue certificates to others. Certificates in these stores are normally supplied with the operating system or by the user's network administrator. Certificates in this store are typically self-signed.

member.name: F:WixSharp.StoreName.otherPeople
member.summary: Contains the certificates of those that the user normally sends enveloped messages to or receives signed messages from. See MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WixSharp.StoreName.trustedPeople
member.summary: Contains the certificates of those directly trusted people and resources.

member.name: F:WixSharp.StoreName.trustedPublisher
member.summary: Contains the certificates of those publishers who are trusted.

member.summary: Logs the error and continues with the startup operation.

member.summary: Logs the error, displays a message box and continues the startup operation.

member.name: F:WixSharp.SvcErrorControl.critical
member.summary: Logs the error if possible and the system is restarted with the last configuration known to be good. If the last-known-good configuration is being started, the startup operation fails.

member.summary: Creates the environment variable if it does not exist, then set it during installation. This has no effect on the value of the environment variable if it already exists.

member.name: F:WixSharp.EnvVarAction.set
member.summary: Creates the environment variable if it does not exist, and then set it during installation. If the environment variable exists, set it during the installation.

member.name: F:WixSharp.EnvVarAction.remove
member.summary: Removes the environment variable during an installation. The installer only removes an environment variable during an installation if the name and value of the variable match the entries in the Name and Value attributes. If you want to remove an environment variable, regardless of its value, do not set the Value attribute.

member.name: F:WixSharp.XmlFileAction.createElement
member.summary: Creates a new element under the element specified in ElementPath. The Name attribute is required in this case and specifies the name of the new element. The Value attribute is not necessary when createElement is specified as the action. If the Value attribute is set, it will cause the new element's text value to be set.

member.name: F:WixSharp.XmlFileAction.deleteValue
member.summary: Deletes a value from the element specified in the ElementPath. If Name is specified, the attribute with that name is deleted. If Name is not specified, the text value of the element specified in the ElementPath is deleted. The Value attribute is ignored if deleteValue is the action specified.

member.name: F:WixSharp.XmlFileAction.setValue
member.summary: Sets a value in the element specified in the ElementPath. If Name is specified, and attribute with that name is set to the value specified in Value. If Name is not specified, the text value of the element is set. Value is a required attribute if setValue is the action specified.

member.name: F:WixSharp.XmlFileAction.bulkSetValue
member.summary: Sets all the values in the elements that match the ElementPath. If Name is specified, attributes with that name are set to the same value specified in Value. If Name is not specified, the text values of the elements are set. Value is a required attribute if setBulkValue is the action specified.

member.name: T:WixSharp.WixQuietExecAction
member.summary:
Defines WiX QtExecCmdLineAction CustomAction.
This class is loseley mapped to the WixQuietExec WiX element. WixQuietExec superseeds older CAQuietExec as well as fixes a few runtime artefacts WiX CAQuietExec was associated with.
executes specified application with optional arguments. You do not have to specify full path to the application to be executed as long as its directory is well-known (e.g. listed in system environment variable PATH) on the target system.
often needs to be executed with the elevated privileges. Thus after instantiation it will have set to false and set to Execute.deferred to allow elevating.
